de.esoco.lib.expression

Interface Predicate<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Boolean>, java.util.function.Predicate<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BinaryPredicate<L,R>, BinaryPredicate.ThrowingBinaryPredicate<L,R,E>, Predicate.ThrowingPredicate<T,E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBinaryPredicate, BinaryPredicateChain, ClassPredicate, ClassPredicate.HasBaseClass, ClassPredicate.HasClass, Comparison, Comparison.ElementOf, Comparison.EqualTo, Comparison.GreaterOrEqual, Comparison.GreaterThan, Comparison.LessOrEqual, Comparison.LessThan, Comparison.Matching, Comparison.SameAs, ExceptionMappingBinaryPredicate, RelationTypeFilter
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Predicate<T>
extends Function<T,java.lang.Boolean>, java.util.function.Predicate<T>
    Interface for predicate functions that return a boolean value that is derived from a target object.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Predicate.ThrowingPredicate<T,E extends java.lang.Exception>
      A sub-interface that allows implementations to throw checked exceptions.

      Predicate<O>      		 and(Predicate<? super T> rOther)

      default <V> Predicate<V> from(Function<V,? extends T> rFunction)

    • Method Detail

      • and

        default <O extends T> Predicate<O> and(Predicate<? super T> rOther)
        Returns a new predicate with a logical AND expression for this and another instance. The other predicate will only be evaluated if this predicate yields TRUE.
        Parameters:
        rOther - The other instance
        Returns:
        A new predicate with a logical AND expression

      • from

        default <V> Predicate<V> from(Function<V,? extends T> rFunction)
        Re-defined from Function.from(Function) to return a new predicate instead of a function so that the result can still be used as a predicate.
        Parameters:
        rFunction - A function that produces input for this predicate
        Returns:
        A new predicate that first applies the argument function to input values and then evaluates the result with this predicate

      • or

        default <O extends T> Predicate<O> or(Predicate<? super T> rOther)
        Returns a new predicate with a logical OR expression for this and another instance. The other predicate will only be evaluated if this predicate yields FALSE.
        Parameters:
        rOther - The other instance
        Returns:
        A new predicate with a logical OR expression

      • test

        default boolean test(T rValue)
        Invokes Function.evaluate(Object).
        Specified by:
        test in interface java.util.function.Predicate<T>
        See Also:
        Predicate.test(Object)
